did.abstract: County Executive of Oakland County Michigan since 1992, former prosecuting attorney in Oakland County; collection includes typed copies of Patterson's speeches, roasts, and editorials; newspaper clippings on topics important to Patterson; press releases; and promotional and other videotapes.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The records were donated by L. Brooks Patterson (donor no. 9941) in 2007.

accruals.p: Periodic additions to the records expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, L. Brooks Patterson papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Patterson received a bachelor's degree from the University of Detroit, and his Juris Doctorate in 1967 from its law school. Upon graduation, he was hired by the Oakland County Prosecuting Attorney as an assistant prosecutor. He left that post in 1971, and in 1972 he ran for Oakland County Prosecutor, winning and serving in this capacity until 1988, when he left for a private law practice. He ran unsuccessfully for the Senate in 1978. In 1992, Patterson was elected Oakland County Executive. He was three-times re-elected. While in this position, Patterson has been involved in many issues, particularly Oakland County-Detroit relations, economic development in Oakland County, and the founding of Automation Alley.

In his career, Patterson has received many honors, including the State of Israel Eleanor Roosevelt Humanities Award in 1996, the March of Dimes Humanitarian of the Year Award; Oakland County Distinguished Citizen of 1991; and the Outstanding Young Men of Michigan Award in 1973. In 1980, Patterson founded the Rainbow Connection, a charity that grants wishes to children with life threatening illnesses.

scopecontent.p: The L. Brooks Patterson collection includes typed copies of Patterson's speeches, roasts, and editorials; newspaper clippings on topics important to Patterson; press releases; and promotional and other videotapes. The collection is organized into the following series: Speeches, Roasts, Press, Miscellaneous, and Other Media.

The Speeches series, the bulk of the collection, includes speeches from 1975 to 2007. The topics of the speeches range from economic forecasts, state of the county addresses, charity events, economic development, patriotic events, and so on. They reflect the wide variety of issues Patterson has faced while in office.

scopecontent.p: The Roasts series consists of the comments made by Patterson at a variety of roasts and other celebratory events in the period of 1976 to 2004. These appearances further document Patterson's active participation in Oakland County and the wide range of his friends and colleagues.

scopecontent.p: The Press series includes photocopies of articles by and about Patterson; newspaper opinion pieces or letters to the editor of the Oakland Press and the two Detroit newspapers; and press releases from the Oakland County Executive's office.
The Miscellaneous series includes proclamations, subject files, notes, political campaign information, and a few pieces of correspondence.

Corp Magazine, Man of the Year, January-February 2000
The Day the Power Went Out
Michigan Humane Society (foreword to book) March 9, 1982

scopecontent.p: The Other Media series consist of seven videotapes from 1992 to 2005. They primarily contain campaign statements, publicity for the Oakland County Prescription Plan, and other laws. This series also consists of one CD with the files from Patterson's web site as of June 13, 2007.
